item.title: [Python] I made a library that divides Japanese sentences nicely
item.description: #Introduction Recently, the development of natural language processing technology has been remarkable and is being applied in various fields. Although I often do business using natural language processing technology and AI, the most troublesome (but important) work is related to various preprocessing. The main pre-processing that you will perform for most tasks are: Cleaning Removes noise in text such as HTML tags and symbols Normalization Full-width/half-width and unification of capital letters and small letters ** sentence segmentation ** Detects sentence breaks and splits Wordization Split sentence into a sequence of words Remove stopword Remove unnecessary words for the task you want to solve I mainly use Python, but I didn’t have a suitable library for ** Japanese sentence breaks **, and I had to write similar code every time.

item.title: [Python] I made a library konoha to switch the tokenizer to a nice one.
item.description: # TL; DR I will introduce konoha, a library for tokenizing sentences. (Formerly tiny_tokenizer) You can use it like ↓. What? from konoha import WordTokenizer sentence = "I am studying natural language processing" tokenizer = WordTokenizer('MeCab') print(tokenizer.tokenize(sentence)) # -> [natural, language, processing, study, study, do, do, masu] tokenizer = WordTokenizer('Kytea') print(tokenizer.tokenize(sentence)) # -> [natural, language, processing, study, study, te, i, ma, su] tokenizer = WordTokenizer('Sentencepiece', model_path="data/model.spm") print(tokenizer.tokenize(sentence)) # -> [, natural, language, processing, studying, doing, doing] Introduction: What is a tokenizer?
